subs.text: It used to be that you could look on Facebook to see who you knew that was in the town you’re currently in. Now you have to … I don’t know. How does one do that nowadays?

subs.text: @toddsieling Sounds right to me. It came to my mind because a woman running in Toronto, in my ward, did just that, i.e. was a high-profile school trustee and is now running for council. I also thought of the former Vancouver councillor with the initials AR.
subs.rawText: @toddsieling Sounds right to me. It came to my mind because a woman running in Toronto, in my ward, did just that, i.e. was a high-profile school trustee and is now running for council. I also thought of the former Vancouver councillor with the initials AR.

subs.text: @toddsieling Since school boards are often a springboard to council, and they own/manage a lot of real estate, I make sure I know who the trustee for my area is, what they stand for, etc.
subs.rawText: @toddsieling Since school boards are often a springboard to council, and they own/manage a lot of real estate, I make sure I know who the trustee for my area is, what they stand for, etc.

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can’t switch. I don’t remember much of anything from my childhood (it’s the reason I don’t feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don’t know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.
subs.rawText: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can’t switch. I don’t remember much of anything from my childhood (it’s the reason I don’t feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don’t know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don’t tell anybody this, I’m right-handed doing everything that isn’t writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay
subs.rawText: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don’t tell anybody this, I’m right-handed doing everything that isn’t writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Being left-handed gets in the way sometimes, because it’s a right-handed world. That said, every time one of us sees another person writing left-handed, we make eye contact, and have an instant rapport. #LeftHandersDay
subs.rawText: @AnakanaSchofiel Being left-handed gets in the way sometimes, because it’s a right-handed world. That said, every time one of us sees another person writing left-handed, we make eye contact, and have an instant rapport. #LeftHandersDay

subs.text: Normally I go to protests I support, even if I don’t know anybody there, so that at least I’d increase the count by one. This one felt different. I didn’t feel like increasing the bike share user count by one.

subs.text: @AlexDRMather @DTAHtoronto @TorontoPFR @moddevelopments @DiamondSchmitt I live nearby, and it’s a big hit. When the food hall opens, it might be hard to find a seat (that’s a good problem for a park to have). The dog park is often full (which means people and the dogs who own them love it) and kids seem to enjoy the playground. Just a huge success.

I would’ve been a handsome hero today if I had happened to have hand lotion on me, but I didn’t, so I wasn’t. What I’m trying to tell you is that I just bought hand lotion.
subs.rawText: I would’ve been a handsome hero today if I had happened to have hand lotion on me, but I didn’t, so I wasn’t. What I’m trying to tell you is that I just bought hand lotion.

subs.text: My handsome heroism today was limited to offering to take a group’s photo. Any time I see someone breaking off from a group to take a photo (or what looks like is going to be a bad group selfie [Hint: almost all group selfies are bad]), I wordlessly offer to take it for them.

subs.text: @toddsieling There’s a desktop mode, easily accessible, which seems pretty open, i.e. you can install software by downloading it from a browser. I didn’t do any unlocking or rooting to install itch.​io games, for example. I just had to install the Linux desktop client and login.
subs.rawText: @toddsieling There’s a desktop mode, easily accessible, which seems pretty open, i.e. you can install software by downloading it from a browser. I didn’t do any unlocking or rooting to install itch.​io games, for example. I just had to install the Linux desktop client and login.

subs.text: @toddsieling 🤔 I just found a less fiddly way to install Epic Games Store games, so maybe I’ll try that again. I installed the [link] launcher almost right after unboxing, though.
subs.rawText: @toddsieling 🤔 I just found a less fiddly way to install Epic Games Store games, so maybe I’ll try that again. I installed the https://t.co/QLPPDNTSSB launcher almost right after unboxing, though.

subs.text: @toddsieling I do. I like it, but I don’t see myself using it for anything other than small games, or soothing exploration games. There’s one game that I’d play a lot on it if it were still on Steam. I could install it if I fiddle a bunch, but would rather not do that.

subs.text:
“The 2017 World Series MVP doesn’t have a trigger for his stutter, though he knows when it’s about to happen and can modify his speech to work around it.”

That rings true. I know some of my triggers, and warming up my voice and remembering to breathe before talking helps a lot.

subs.text: I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It’s one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal [link]
subs.rawText: I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It’s one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal https://t.co/Iklbp4tWeG

subs.text: Turning content into a “book” may have been the module’s original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.
subs.rawText: Turning content into a “book” may have been the module’s original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.

subs.text: They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there’s no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).
subs.rawText: They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there’s no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).

@rtanglao I procrastinate about everything else, but the prospect of Singaporean-Malaysian food in Toronto, and close by, no less, had me leaping out of my seat!

subs.text: Do you feel like all of the possible opinions about something have been expressed by the time you get to a news item?
subs.rawText: Do you feel like all of the possible opinions about something have been expressed by the time you get to a news item?

subs.text: We’re living in an era where somebody else has already been the first to express their feelings about something, and all you can do is press the 👍🏻 or ❤️ button on it.
subs.rawText: We’re living in an era where somebody else has already been the first to express their feelings about something, and all you can do is press the 👍🏻 or ❤️ button on it.

subs.text: The Amber Alert system can, and should, be improved.
subs.rawText: The Amber Alert system can, and should, be improved.

subs.text: For instance, when linking to a website in an Amber Alert, the website should be able to withstand a large and sudden traffic spike.
subs.rawText: For instance, when linking to a website in an Amber Alert, the website should be able to withstand a large and sudden traffic spike.

subs.text: When the website does work, it shouldn’t show that there are no active alerts when there is an active alert. [link]
